name: Mojave Resort

reviews.title: California charm in the desert
reviews.text: I just returned from an extended Memorial Weekend trip with a group of gals who've been getting together for the last 29 years. Our regular hotel shut it's doors last year, forcing us to find a new location and am I ever glad we did! We found the Mojave Resort - and it's terrific!

There are 21 rooms in this intimate setting and they all open into a lovely, peaceful courtyard full of trees, shade and even a koi pond. The airy gazebo is a place for adults to gather for a leisurely drink. A beautiful old tree provides a bit of shade over one end of the pool as the day passes to late afternoon - a welcome respite from the heat and sun.
reviews.title: Perfect!
Outstanding employees
reviews.text: Almost every room is different, offering various features such as fireplaces, extra large bathrooms (including handicapped accesible), suites and some rooms even have a small kitchen. Each morning the resort provided breakfast including excellent coffee, cereal, bagels, muffins, yogurt and juice. The staff was extremely friendly and the service was great.

reviews.title: My Secret Little Orange Gem
reviews.text: I only have two grumbles, the cleaning crew was lax and failed to clear away our dirty glasses and provide clean ones. They also cleaned the empty rooms first and we had to ask to have our rooms cleaned earlier (4pm is just too late to clean the room!). And not to seem like the grinch - there was a group of 5 couples with 10 kids between them and those kids made a lot of noise. I hope next year there are fewer kids - and it's quieter!

reviews.title: Charming down-to-earth hotel
reviews.text: The Mojave truly is a little gem in the desert. I loved so much about it -- the hip 40's style, our roomy room (with kitchenette and dressing/bath area), the comfortable bed, the friendly and accommodating staff (thanks, Joe!), the cleanliness, the lovely courtyard with pool and spa tub and massage tent, the grapefruit trees, the nice breakfast we could eat poolside , the proximity to downtown Palm Desert. I had a wonderful, relaxing weekend at the Mojave and I plan to return again and again. I wish I lived closer so I could visit more often!

The Mojave is a small 'resort' near the downtown strip of Palm Desert. It's in a residential area, surrounded by single-family homes, yet a short walk to Tiffany-type shopping. There's no big sign .... I needed my Google map print-out to find the Mohave. From the outside it is NOT impressive .. sort of looks like a tacky road motel with parking spaces butting up against the back of the one-story building. But enter into the courtyard, and suddenly you've stepped back in time to a beautifully-landscaped inner sanctum with wannabe has-been movie stars hanging out around the pool. Orange-painted accents are everywhere , giving the Mohave a funky art-deco feel. The check-in and check out clerks were matter-of-fact, seemingly a bit hurried for our one-night stay. The room was spacious with mini-kitchen, and had a comfy bed. The bathroom tile looked somewhat dated in color and wear. Regrettably, I was welcomed into the shower by the sight of a dead creepy-crawly -- this is a ground-level older 'resort'. I paid about $130 for a night and got a self-serve cereal/yogurt/bread/fruit/coffee breakfast.
reviews.title: What was that???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this place. I went during one of the hottest weekends ever, but I was looking to just relax and get out of the big city. I got there and was shown to our room, which I loved. Very spacious and clean. The best was the privacy. And I loved the breakfast. The amenities were wonderful. Shampoos, conditioners and soaps were great. The staff were very attentive. Always available and ready to satisfy. Short walking distance to a couple of restaurants and shops. I will be going there again in December. Even though I don't want to tell anyone about this gem, I just had to give them kudos.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: I decided to stay for one night at Mojave Resort after checking out Tripadvisor to find a place I've never been before. I am a Palm Desert local resident, but had a flood at my home and needed to vacate the premises for awhile, and decided to do one night at the Mojave.
reviews.title: Step Back In Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like others, I was very skeptical when I pulled up in front of this place, it looked a little shady to say the least.
reviews.title: What a cool place to stay in a hot desert!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, stylish decor, comfortable bed

reviews.text: The gentleman who checked us in was very nice and showed us to our room - an oversized King with a patio - #1.
reviews.title: Nice & Relaxing

reviews.text: After reading previous reviews I have to say that you should really ratchet your expectations down a bit when coming to this hotel. It's nicely situated off the Paseo. It is a nice re-do of a quaint old 40's motel... the colors and styling are fun and funky. The rooms are clean. The courtyard is a good size with lovely trees and lots of grapefruit! We had two rooms for two nights mid week... a king with Kitchenette and Double Queen -- they were a bit dark, and a bit small, but certainly better than many hotels we've stayed in.
reviews.title: We can't decide if we liked it....

likes.disliked: — Size of pool area creates a real need for courtesy among guests. Hope for the best.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The road is noisy -- and the parking is right outside your window, so people going to their cars in the early morning will talk and slam their car doors only feet from your head... so ask for a room away from the street: #'s 11-20 are the best side.
reviews.title: Sweet, Sweet Mojave

likes.liked: — Groovy 50's vibe, fun decor, great martini shaker shaped pool
likes.disliked: — Bathrooms can be a little funky depending on what unit you get: remember though, you are outside 95% of the time in Palm Desert :)

reviews.title: Hidden Gem
reviews.text: We had problems with 2 things. First off the maintenance of the courtyard was really not good. Yes, it was a windy week, but another guest and I tried to clean the pool ourselves each day -- other than that no one touched it. Same with the walkways and pool areas -- myself and other guests were sweeping leaves, so they wouldn't blow into the pool. I wiped down the tables each morning as they were covered in dust... no one ever checked to see if they were clean or not. C'mon guys -- the reason people come to Palm Springs is to be by the pool -- isn't keeping it clean a priority? We saw a hotel employee pickup fallen grapefruit but the juice they left was splattered everywhere making the walkways very sticky -- a quick hose down would have helped things immensely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Secondly, the quality of your stay in this intimate atmosphere depends on the other guests. Our first two days we very much enjoyed the people at the hotel -- moms with their teens (we were travelling with our two sons) a few older couples and two couples with young well mannered kids. But the afternoon of our second day a younger group moved in -- for a wedding I think, and basically started to take things over. We watched as these young men and women carried cases of beer into the rooms. We listened to people talking and stomping around all night -- going to and from rooms and in and out of the resort... and I mean ALL night.. There is no staff on premises after 10 pm so you are basically on your own.
reviews.title: Move back in time.

reviews.text: They invited friends over from other hotels (we heard them at the pool on their cell phones) and that put a strain on the facilities (there were only 15 lounge chairs by the pool -- when we left this group had all of them) They had a radio going and were smoking -- If I wanted that I would have stayed at the Desert Springs Marriott. We were VERY glad we weren't going to be there over the weekend and in fact we decided that if we ever did return it would be mid-week only.
reviews.title: Retro Chic

reviews.text: I had to go to Court in Indio and found a deal for Mojave Resort in Palm Desert through Orbitz ($75 per night). For the price, I was very happy with my stay. One reviewer said that it is nestled in a residential area and, from the outside, isn't very impressive. This is definitely true. The location, in a quiet residential neighborhood, is great, but it looks plain and small from the outside.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself, however, was spacious and clean, which is all you can really ask for for the price. The bed was comfortable, as was the other furniture in the room. Good lighting... and there was a nice large pool (which I did not partake in). They provided breakfast (bagels, cereal, juice, etc.) which was an added bonus. I'm rating this hotel "Excellent" based purely on the quality of the room considering its affordable price. I've stayed in "value" hotels that were twice the price but no where close the quality.
reviews.title: Better then expected

likes.liked: — Quaint, serene, friendly staff, comfortable accomodations, convienent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This motel was recommended to me by a friend 2 years ago and I was finally able to take her advise and stay for 2 nights this past weekend. The Mojave is very quaint and comfortable. The owner, who greeted us at the desk, was friendly and welcoming. Our room was updated with period style furnishings. Very charming. Very clean. The room had a small frig, lots of channels on the tv and a great bed. The pool and grounds are very nicely kept and clean. The hours for the pool are 7am to 11pm which is great. We had 2 rooms and the staff was so gracious and accomodating. Bagels, muffins and coffee were ready Sat and Sunday. The motel is walking distance from the Paseo and wonderful restaurants and shops. We loved our stay and will definately return.
reviews.title: Desert Home away from Home

reviews.text: We stumbled upon the Mojave just once & the hospitality was so warm, the location so great and the rooms so tastefully appointed that we would now never consider going anywhere else when we get away to the desert for the weekend. It's just such a relaxing low-stress place to stay - like visiting a relative who provides everything you need but gives you plenty of space.
reviews.title: Great Quiet Escape
Mojave tries hard to please
reviews.text: Ask for a room with a fireplace.

description: Experience the romance, glamour and sophistication of the desert of the 1940s...indulgent suites and guestrooms with dreamy beds and all the special touches you expect - from breakfast poolside to spa treatments under the stars. Just steps from the desert's finest shops and restaurants on El Paseo, yet decades away.
